name: dishearteningly
content:
Add to word list

in a way that causes you to lose confidence, hope, and energy: Dishearteningly, things then came to a stop again. The scenes that greeted commuters the next day were dishearteningly familiar.
More examplesFewer examplesThe staff turnover rate for the organization was dishearteningly high. There is clearly still a long way to go when the evidence of under-achievement is so dishearteningly widespread. The industry will require more support than ever, and it will probably be dishearteningly slow in coming.
